title: Dawn of the New Year
byline: The Sinhala and Tamil New Year will officially dawn at 3:21 AM on Monday, April 14, marking the transition from the old year to the new.

title: Preparing food and consuming food
byline: The first meal of the New Year will be prepared at the auspicious time of 4:04 AM on Monday, April 14, in accordance with traditional customs.

title: Starting work, transactions, and sharing the first meal
byline: At the auspicious time of 6:44 AM on Monday, April 14, people will begin the traditional New Year customs of starting work, engaging in transactions, and sharing the first meal.

title: China urges US to 'completely cancel' tariffs
byline: Chinese officials are calling on US President Donald Trump to ’’completely cancel’’ his so-called reciprocal tariffs, as a trade war between the world’s two biggest economies grinds on.

title: Prime Minister’s New Year message
byline: Let us step into the New Year with renewed hope and a vision, as we continue to work together toward “a prosperous country and a beautiful life.”

title: President’s New Year Message
byline: As we celebrate the Sinhala and Tamil New Year this year, a festival that symbolises the hope of both physical and spiritual renewal, our nation finds itself at a defining moment, achieving significant victories while resolutely striving towards the realisation of a better and more prosperous future.

title: Three Lankans nabbed with Kush, Hashish
byline: Three Sri Lankan passengers were arrested while attempting to smuggle a stock of Kush and Hashish into the country, concealed in biscuit and chips bags, Customs Additional Director and Spokesman Sivali Arukgoda said.

title: Head-on crash in Akbarpura kills bus driver
byline: A head-on collision between a bus and an Army truck occurred a short while ago in the Akbarpura area, killing the bus driver, the Akbarpura Police said.

title: Expressways earn Rs. 134 Mn in 3 days
byline: The expressway network has generated Rs. 134 million in revenue over the past three days, coinciding with the New Year season, according to the Expressway Maintenance and Management Division.

title: Multiple deaths in separate road accidents
byline: Five people were reported dead in separate road accidents reported from Maho, Manampitiya, Balangoda and Silawathura, police said.

title: Head-on crash in Agbopura kills bus driver
byline: A head-on collision between a bus and an Army truck occurred a short while ago in the Agbopura area, killing the bus driver, the Akbarpura Police said.
